headline: Faces of Foreclosure
summary: The foreclosure crisis that erupted four years ago and has claimed the homes of more than five million Americans began in lower-income communities.

headline: U.S. Open to Wind-Energy Projects
summary: The Obama administration is looking to lease an area in waters off the coast of Massachusetts for wind-energy projects.

headline: Year in Review: Are IPOs Gone for Good?
summary: The downturn slowed initial public offerings. Will they return?

headline: ETA 'Close' to Laying Down Arms
summary: The Spanish government believes ETA is close to surrendering its arms but will treat any new promises of peace from the Basque terrorist group with caution.

headline: Yen, Swiss Franc Climb
summary: The yen advanced, hitting multiweek highs, after encouraging industrial production data from Japan. The dollar hit a record low versus the Swiss franc.

headline: Production Recovery Brightens Japan Outlook
summary: Japan's industrial output rose for the first time in six months and is expected to gain more in the near future, soothing concerns that deflationary pressures will lead to a sharp economic slowdown.

headline: Pakistan Party Quits Cabinet
summary: A key coalition partner in Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari's government said it will pull its ministers from the country's federal cabinet, further weakening an administration that is already facing an economic meltdown and rising threats from Taliban insurgents.

headline: Photos of the Day
summary: In today's pictures, a New Jersey driver is snowed in, Indians warm themselves by a fire, Australia faces floods and more.

headline: Gold Futures Settle Above $1,400
summary: Comex gold futures climbed back above $1,400 ahead of the expiry of options contracts.

headline: Anarchists Linked to Bombs in Rome
summary: Italian investigators confirmed links between Italian and Greek anarchists in the latest bombing campaign in Rome, and said that the level of alert remains high, although they added that they don't expect the violent campaign to intensify.

headline: Rohac and Sinclair: Preparing Another Meltdown
summary: The post-crisis re-regulation of financial markets may cause the next crisis.

headline: Oil Slough Off Weak Data to End Higher
summary: Crude-oil prices finished higher, as traders brushed off reports on falling U.S. home prices and consumer confidence and drew support from expectations of long-term economic recovery.

headline: FTC Clears Proposed Buyout of Dynegy
summary: The FTC approved billionaire investor Carl Icahn's proposed $665 million buyout of power-generation company Dynegy.

headline: Steelmakers Grapple With Price-Increase Pressures
summary: Steelmakers will have difficulty passing on all of their rising input costs to end users in the coming year.

headline: The Housing Map
summary: Keep an eye on Phoenix. Until early 2009, it vied with Vegas for the country's biggest drop from peak prices. It is now the second-worst, down 53.4%. However, while Vegas appears to have stabilized, Phoenix's 12-month trend has deteriorated from a gain of 7.2% in May's index to a decline of 4.3% in the latest. Phoenix's struggle to rise from the ashes isn't over yet.

headline: Stocks Fall for Fifth Day in a Row in China
summary: China's stock market fell 1.7%, its fifth consecutive drop, on concerns that Saturday's interest-rate increase could be but the first round of tightening by Beijing.

headline: Judge Approves Lehman Compromise
summary: A federal judge approved a compromise between Lehman Brothers and a bankruptcy trustee, paving the way for the sale of a handful of stalled Southern California real-estate projects Lehman helped finance with SunCal.

headline: Brazil Companies Keen to Tap Markets
summary: Companies in Brazil are expected to seek similar amounts of capital in 2011 to the record-breaking level seen this year, and the numbers won't be distorted by the large share sale by the government-run oil company.

headline: European Stocks Mixed
summary: European stock markets ended narrowly mixed, with investors struggling to find direction in a thin session.

headline: India on Terror Alert
summary: India increased security in major cities across the country after receiving information that a Pakistan-based militant group was planning an attack over New Year's weekend.

headline: China Shares Fall 1.7%
summary: Asian stock markets were mixed Tuesday, with Shanghai falling 1.7% to its lowest level in nearly three months on concerns of further tightening measures. Meanwhile, technology and construction stocks lifted Korea's Kopsi index by 0.6%.

headline: Sears Launches Movie-Download Service
summary: Sears launched its online movie download service on Sonic Solutions' RoxioNow platform, allowing Sears and K-Mart customers to download movies the same day they are released on DVD.

headline: ECB's Mersch Urges Stiffer Penalties for Rulebreakers
summary: Proposals to stiffen penalties for profligate euro-zone members don't go far enough, said European Central Bank governing council member Yves Mersch.

headline: ICVL May Look for Minority Stake in Riversdale
summary: A joint venture between five Indian state-run companies may not make a counter bid to Rio Tinto's $3.9 billion takeover offer for Perth-based Riversdale Mining, but may look to buy a minority stake, a person familiar with the developments said.

headline: Toshiba to Buy Hard-Disc Unit Stake
summary: Toshiba Corp. has bought a stake in a hard-disk drive research and development joint venture from its partner Fujitsu Ltd. to make the unit 100%-owned, the two companies said in a joint press release Tuesday.

headline: Japanese Yields Drop
summary: Japanese government bond yields fell, helped by lower U.S. yields and the yen's gains to a three-week high against the dollar.

headline: England Strangle Beleaguered Australia
summary: On the third day of the fourth Ashes test in Melbourne, England proved once and for all that they are, undeniably, a better cricket team than Australia. Simple, writes Michael Atherton.

headline: Spanish Household Power Prices to Jump
summary: The Spanish government's move to raise household electricity prices by 9.8% could stoke inflation as the prices pass through households and into the larger economy.

headline: French 3Q GDP Revised to 0.3%
summary: The French economy expanded less than expected due to lower investments in the service sector and public works, revised data showed.

headline: Satyam Gets Audit Notice
summary: Satyam Computer Services said it has received a letter from India's tax department requesting it to get its accounts audited for the tax assessment years of 2002-2003 and 2007-2008.

headline: Dense Fog in North India
summary: Dense fog in New Delhi on Monday disrupted train and air traffic. The fog descended over the weekend and is expected to continue. Some snapshots.

headline: India U.S. Ties in 2010

headline: Patni Brothers Still Split Over Stake Sale

headline: Obama's Budget Delayed a Week
summary: President Barack Obama's budget proposal for fiscal 2012 will be released in mid-February, a little more than a week after its planned release date.

summary: National rivalry always lurks around an industry as dependent on government support as renewable energy.

headline: AIG Stock's Unlikely Comeback

headline: Qantas Copes With Crisis Aftermath

summary: Thousands are fleeing the Ivory Coast as tensions continue to rise in the West African country after a delayed and then disputed presidential election. Review recent key dates.

summary: Private trading in shares of closely held tech favorites such as Facebook and Twitter has surged in recent months, suggesting strong investor interest in some tech start-ups.

summary: Americans prefer a leader who does not stand aloof from the weight and the lessons of our history.

summary: Boxer Manny Pacquiao, in his own proud words.

headline: Snow Hinders Emergency Responders
summary: Ambulances struggled to respond after the blizzard, with a backlog of more than 1,000 calls. One woman with a broken ankle waited more than 24 hours for an ambulance.

headline: Taxing Analysis, From Comics to IUDs
summary: If you thought New York's bagel tax was complicated, chew on this: Edible aloe leaves are not subject to sales tax, just as long as they are not sold in potted form.

headline: Lenovo Hones Sales Pitch for Russia, India
summary: Lenovo is notching success in emerging markets, gaining market share in such places as Russia and India, where the Chinese PC maker can use experience gained at home to woo lower-income customers.

summary: With one game left in the regular season, the Jets' highly-touted defense can't seem to stop anyone.

headline: Caveat Investor: ETNs Tied to VIX
summary: Wall Street has developed several new exchange-traded notes tied to the market's fear index, the VIX, to help cope with market volatility. But investors beware: These instruments come with plenty of risks.

summary: The Census deprives New Jersey of a House seat.  Global View will resume next week.

summary: Hitachi is in talks with Taiwanese contract manufacturer Hon Hai Precision Industry about an investment in the Japanese electronics conglomerate's small- to mid-sized liquid crystal display panel business.

summary: Columnist Jonathan Welsh answers readers' questions on uncomfortable headrests, auto makers that put batteries under the back seat, and more.

summary: More than a quarter of children and teens are taking a prescription drug for a chronic ailment on a regular basis.

headline: Baghdad to Tackle Oil Issues, PM Vows
summary: Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki said his government would tackle logistical and other obstacles facing international oil firms working in Iraq, saying his country desperately needs to boost oil revenues to meet its massive infrastructure-investment needs.

headline: Fred Upton and Tim Phillips: How Congress Can Stop the EPA's Power Grab
summary: Courts have yet to decide if the agency's proposed controls on carbon emissions are even legal.

headline: Companies Sweat British Bribery Law
summary: Multinational companies face a new British law they fear will force them to rethink their compliance strategies and upend their business practices.

headline: Efforts to Block Gene in Huntington's
summary: A new attempt to use rna interference to stop the production of proteins that give rise to the disease.

summary: Business is booming for modern-day practitioners of hoodoo, as customers from all over the country turn to the ancient belief system for help with slashing debt, staving off foreclosures or finding jobs.

headline: Iraq Says U.S. Must Leave On Time
summary: Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki ruled out any U.S. troops in Iraq after the end of 2011, saying his new government and the country's security forces were capable of confronting any remaining threats to the country.

headline: Euro Gains on Dollar, Yen
summary: The euro rose against the dollar and yen, as currency traders brushed aside concerns about China's interest-rate increase.

headline: Japan's Superbad Budget
summary: Japan's $1.1 trillion budget for next year is filled with unwanted superlatives: the nation's largest outlay ever, the worst debt-to-GDP ratio among industrial nations and the second consecutive year that debt issuance will exceed tax revenue.

summary: Finding ways to spur innovation in product-design and business models will be key to sparking domestic demand.

summary: GM could face a difficult 2011 but new and refreshed models beginning in 2012 are reasons investors should buy the car maker's stock, according to bullish analysts whose banks backed the company's IPO.

summary: American International Group said it has obtained new credit lines from commercial banks to replace its bailout aid from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

summary: New York City's response to the blizzard has been hampered by Mayor Bloomberg's decision to reduce the Sanitation Department's work force as part of citywide budget cuts.

summary: Iraq's formation of a new coalition government was an important national-security moment for the U.S., the vice president said in an interview.

summary: Hugo Wolf's 150th birthday passed under the shadow of bigger names who also celebrated anniversaries this year. The composer's obscurity belies his contributions to German art songs.
